2.name: Quo Vadis?
2.description: An epic Italian film "Quo Vadis" influenced many of the later movies.

3.name: Der Student von Prag
3.description: Balduin, a student of Prague, leaves his roystering companions in the beer garden, when he finds he has reached the end of his resources. He is scarcely seated in a quiet corner when a ...                See full summary »

4.name: Fantômas - À l'ombre de la guillotine
4.description: Inspector Juve is tasked to investigate and capture an infamous criminal Fantomas.

5.name: Gli ultimi giorni di Pompei
5.description: Two love triangles intersect in ancient Pompei.

6.name: Traffic in Souls
6.description: A woman, with the aid of her police officer sweetheart, endeavors to uncover the prostitution ring that has kidnapped her sister, and the philanthropist who secretly runs it.

8.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
8.description: King Rudolf of Ruritania is saved from a coup attempt by the help of his lookalike cousin, who falls in love with the king's fiancee.

9.name: Germinal
9.description: The mechanic Etienne Lantier is a competent workman out of a job, whose tempestuous disposition is more than atoned for by a good heart. With bundle in hand he looks for work from town to ...                See full summary »

10.name: Ivanhoe
10.description: Back from a crusade, the hero of Sir Walter Scott's novel fights for courtly love and Saxon honor.

11.name: Ingeborg Holm
11.description: Single mother is separated from her children due to financial struggles.

12.name: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
12.description: A peasant girl sent to make a claim on her family's ancestral home in England's Wessex is seduced and left with child by its current owner.

13.name: Gränsfolken
13.description: Two brothers compete for the love of a woman while the impending war threatens to separate them from both sides of the border. Based on the novel "La Débâcle" by Émile Zola.

14.name: From Dusk to Dawn
14.description: An employee of an iron works is fired as a dangerous agitator, and after his friend dies in an explosion at the iron works, he runs for governor on a labor ticket.

15.name: Le mort qui tue
15.description: After a body disappears from inside the prison, a series of crimes take place, all seemingly by the dead man. With Juve presumed dead, Fandor must investigate alone. Will Fantomas finally be brought to justice?

16.name: Atlantis
16.description: After Dr. Friedrich's wife becomes mentally unstable and his research papers are rejected, he leaves the country to respite.

17.name: Juve contre Fantômas
17.description: In Part Two of Louis Feuillade's 5 1/2-hour epic follows FantÃ'mas, the criminal lord of Paris, master of disguise, the creeping assassin in black, as he is pursued by the equally resourceful Inspector Juve.

18.name: På livets ödesvägar
18.description: The son of a poor fisherman and the daughter of a wealthy landlord fall in love, but meet with obstacles to being together. Their happiness meets with objection by her father, who intends to permanently separate them.

19.name: David Copperfield
19.description: A gentle orphan discovers life and love in an indifferent adult world.

20.name: Le avventure straordinarissime di Saturnino Farandola
20.description: Episode 2: "Zingo and the White Elephant" Zingo and his wife, Sari, who are returning from their adventures in Mexico, when Zingo learns from his newspaper that the Royal Elephant of Siam ...                See full synopsis »

21.name: Robin Hood
21.description: Robin Hood and his followers aid the poor and oppressed from their hideout in Sherwood Forest, pursued by the Sheriff of Nottingham.

22.name: L'enfant de Paris
22.description: The young daughter of an army captain missing in action runs away from school and is kidnapped by Parisian lowlifes. When the kidnapper flees to Nice with the child, the kind-hearted employee of one of his accomplices sets off in pursuit.

23.name: The Sea Wolf
23.description: The cruel captain of a schooner dominates the shipwreck victims he picks up.

24.name: The Count of Monte Cristo
24.description: A French sailor, imprisoned for years on false charges of conpiring against the king, escapes and exacts revenge on his accusers.

25.name: Marc'Antonio e Cleopatra
25.description: After the murder of her lover Julius Caesar, Egypt's queen Cleopatra needs a new ally. She seduces his probable successor Mark Antony. This develops into real love and slowly leads to a war with the other possible successor, Octavius.

26.name: Die Suffragette
26.description: Nelly's mother is a suffragette and persuades her daughter to join the good cause. Placing a bomb under Lord William's chair love develops between the two.

27.name: A Message from Mars
27.description: A Martian is sentenced to visit Earth to cure a selfish man.

28.name: Sapho
28.description: A woman with a notorious past enchants a student preparing for the foreign service.

29.name: Lime Kiln Club Field Day
29.description: Modeled after a popular collection of stories known as "Brother Gardener's Lime Kiln Club," the plot features three suitors vying to win the hand of the local beauty.

30.name: In the Bishop's Carriage
30.description: A successful stage actress with a hidden past as a criminal is kept on the path of righteousness by a benefactor.

31.name: Das schwarze Los
31.description: About members of a Commedia dell'arte troupe . Initially cheerful, later tragic events in a triangular relationship consisting of the classic Commedia triumvirate Pierrot, Colombina and Arlecchino.

33.name: Caprice
33.description: A wealthy young man's marriage to a mountain girl he meets while hunting is disastrous until she abandons him and later reappears incognito as a tutored and sophisticated woman.

34.name: In the Hands of London Crooks
34.description: A disowned gambler, framed for forgery, becomes a hero in Afghanistan and wins at Goodwood.

35.name: Hamlet
35.description: The opening scene is in Elsinore, where a ghost is seen by the sentinels keeping guard on the battlements of the castle. This is related to Hamlet by his friend Horatio, who describes the ...                See full summary »

36.name: La Glu
36.description: Fernande, the daughter of poor parents, is very much dissatisfied with her lot in life and wants to get out where she can have some pleasure. She is a great flirt and has several men on the...                See full summary »

37.name: Sumerki zhenskoy dushi
37.description: A young, rich woman decides to dedicate her life to helping the poor, but a tragic incident changes her life.

38.name: Sodoms Ende
38.description: A tragedy of an artistic life in Berlin.

39.name: His Neighbor's Wife
39.description: Mr. Norton discovers his wife in the arms of his neighbor, Captain Roberts, a married man. His first maddened impulse is to kill his faithless wife, but on his way for the gun his little ...                See full summary »

40.name: Eva
40.description: Haskell Brown takes up the promotion of the "Golden Nugget" Mining Company, and staking his honor on the proposition advises all his friends to buy stock in it. One of them, Robert ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Battle of Gettysburg
41.description: A young woman's sweetheart fights for the Union, while her brother fights for the Confederates, in the pivotal 1863 battle of the U.S. Civil War.

42.name: Les misérables - Époque 1: Jean Valjean
42.description: The story begins with Jean Valjean as a humble worker endeavoring to provide for his invalid mother. They live in a squalid home, made more wretched by his inability to provide sufficient ...                See full summary »

43.name: Les misérables - Époque 2: Fantine
43.description: Jean Valjean, guilty of a minor theft of food, is pursued and hounded for years by a relentless lawman, Javert.

46.name: Den okända
46.description: A rich young man falls for a beautiful girl and meets with trouble.

47.name: The House of Temperley
47.description: A blacksmith's adopted son is accused of killing his cardsharping brother.

48.name: What 80 Million Women Want
48.description: A suffragist exposes a corrupt political boss who had compromised her lawyer fiancé.

49.name: Votsareniye doma Romanovykh
49.description: A significant part of the 1912 production "A Life for the Tsar" was used in this film.
